sentences.en: Don't be too lenient with him.
He decided to be reasonably lenient.
He is lenient to the children.
I'm lenient enough , Lord knows, but I don't propose to be imposed upon all the time.
sentences.cn: 天知道,我待人多么宽大, 可是我不想老是给人钻空子呀.

sentences.en: Imposing a lenient sentence for such a serious crime sets a dangerous precedent.
sentences.cn: 对这样严重的罪行轻判就开了个危险的先例.

sentences.en: In other points, as well as this, I was growing very lenient to my master.
sentences.cn: 在其他各点上, 如同在这一点上一样, 我越来越对我的主人宽容了.

sentences.en: Poor dear old Bishop Grantly had on this matter been too lenient.
sentences.cn: 已故的亲爱的老格伦雷主教在这个问题上过分宽厚.

sentences.en: Professor Oswald takes a slightly more lenient view.
sentences.cn: 奥斯瓦尔德教授的观点稍微温和些。

sentences.en: School examiners say that marking has become more lenient in recent years.
sentences.cn: 学校的阅卷人称近年来评分标准放宽了。

sentences.en: She was very lenient towards him.
She was very towardly and lenient.
The judge was lenient with him.
The judge was lenient with the wrongdoer.
sentences.cn: 法官对这个犯人很宽大.

sentences.en: The law on libel is considered too lenient.
sentences.cn: 反诽谤法被认为太宽大了.

sentences.en: the lenient sentences handed down by some judges
sentences.cn: 一些法官作出的宽大判决

sentences.en: Vida was lenient to Carol at the surgical - dressing class.
sentences.cn: 维达在外科护士训练班上对卡萝尔显得很客气.

sentences.en: You should be lenient with them.

trans.tran_cn: 宽大的，仁慈的，<古>减轻痛苦的，缓解的，宽容
